Erik Wilde, INNOQ: How hard can it be? The case for API Platforms

(2) Summary

Platform engineering is rapidly gaining traction for compelling reasons. As we continually expand our arsenal of digital building blocks, mastering the art of creating and using these components efficiently becomes crucial. This talk delves into the essence of platform engineering, exploring its synergy with API management and API platforms, and how the latter can significantly bolster platform engineering efforts. We will dissect the nuances of platform engineering, comparing and contrasting it with traditional API management approaches. Furthermore, we will explore a widely recognized platform engineering maturity model, providing insights into its application and how it can guide you through the complexities of managing your API ecosystem.

The Platform Principle Erik Wilde, INNOQ: How hard can it be? The case for API Platforms

(7) You can not not build a Platform



The Platform Principle Erik Wilde, INNOQ: How hard can it be? The case for API Platforms

(8) Getting Started with APIs

  • Initial pockets of experimentation with APIs
  • Risk is small-ish because the surface is relatively small
  • High degree of freedom because there is no established platform
  • Different teams will come up with different solutions for the same problem


The Platform Principle Erik Wilde, INNOQ: How hard can it be? The case for API Platforms

(9) APIs are gaining Momentum

  • Internal and external factors help with the adoption of APIs
  • Risk becomes higher because the surface is growing rapidly
  • Practices and patterns emerge by teams sharing information and tooling
  • Governance becomes an issue to manage and support growth


The Platform Principle Erik Wilde, INNOQ: How hard can it be? The case for API Platforms

(10) Scaling API Landscapes

  • APIs are recognized as being strategic for both internal and external reasons
  • Risk management needs to be adapted to the strategic importance
  • More API development means increasing economies of scale
  • Scaling the API practice leads to some form of platform engineering
